Package jdrasil.graph.invariants

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Clique<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
    A clique in a graph is a subset of its vertices such that all vertices within the clique are pairwise adjacent.
    ConnectedComponents<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
    The connected components of a graph are equivalence classes with respect to vertex relation "is reachable".
    Invariant<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>,Value,Image>
    A graph property is a class of graphs that is closed under isomorphism.
    Matching<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
    A matching in a graph \(G=(V,E)\) is a subset of the edges \(M\subseteq E\) such that for every vertex \(v\in V\) we have \(|\{\,e\mid e\in M\wedge v\in e\,\}|\leq 1\).
    MinimalSeparator<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
    Computes a minimum separating vertex set, i.e. a vertex set of minimal size such that its removal splits the graph into at least two connected components.
    TwinDecomposition<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
    Compute all twins of the graph in time O(n+m) using the partition refinement paradigm.
    VertexCover<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
    A vertex-cover of a graph is a subset of its vertices such that every edge is incident to at least one of these vertices.
